Post.title: videojs
Post.content:
1.m3u8

vuevue-video-player
videojsdispose()

<template>
    <div class="video-box">
        <video :id="id" class="video-js vjs-default-skin vjs-big-play-centered" width="100%" height="100%">
            <source v-if="/.m3u8/.test(src)" :src="src" type="application/x-mpegURL">
            <source v-else :src="src" :type="item.format | filterFormat">
            <p class="vjs-no-js">
                HTML5
            </p>
        </video>
    </div>
</template>

<script>

export default {
    name: 'VideoBox',
    filters: {
        filterFormat(val) {
            let mimeType = ''
            // mov,mp4 
            switch (val) {
                case 'flv':
                    mimeType = 'video/x-flv'
                    break
                case 'wmv':
                    mimeType = 'video/x-ms-wmv'
                    break
                case 'avi':
                    mimeType = 'video/x-msvideo'
                    break
                default:
                    mimeType = 'video/mp4'
            }
            console.log(mimeType)
            return mimeType
        }
    },
    props: {
        item: {
            type: Object,
            default: () => {}
        }
    },
    data() {
        return {
	        myPlayer: null
        }
    },
    computed: {
        src() {
            return this.item.video_uril
        },
        id() {
            return 'Id' + this.item.id || 'Id'
        }
    },
    mounted() {
        console.log('mounted player')
        this.playVideo()
    },
	beforeDestroy() {
        console.log('video beforeDestroy')
        console.log(this.myPlayer)
		this.myPlayer.dispose()
    },
    methods: {
        playVideo() {
            this.$nextTick(_ => {
                console.log(this.src, this.id)
                if (this.src) {
                    // eslint-disable-next-line
                    this.myPlayer = videojs(this.id, {
                        autoplay: true,
                        controls: true, // 
                        poster: "",
                        techOrder: ["flash"],
                        muted: false, // 
                        preload: "auto", // 
                        language: "zh-CN", // 
                        playbackRates: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 10, 20]// 
                    }, function() {
                        // console.log("----------------------------");
                        this.one("playing", function() { // 
                            console.log("")
                        })
                        this.one("error", function(error) { // 
                            console.error("%o", error)
                        })
                    })
                }
            })
        },
        dispose() {
            console.log('dispose')
            this.myPlayer.dispose()
            this.myPlayer = null
        }
    }
}
</script>

<style scoped lang="scss">
.video-box{
    height: 400px;
    width: 100%;
    margin: 0 auto;
}
div{
    width: 100%;
    height: 100%;
    position: relative;
}
</style>

2.MIME

MIME Type
Flash .flv video/x-flv H.264+MP3
MPEG-4 .mp4 video/mp4 H.264+AAC,H263+AAC
iPhone Index .m3u8 application/x-mpegURL
iPhone Segment .3gp video/3gpp
3GP Mobile .ts video/MP2T
QuickTime .mov video/quicktime H.264+AAC
A/V Interleave .avi video/x-msvideo Xvid+MP3
Windows Media .wmv ideo/x-ms-wmv VC-1+WMA

3.
HLS HTTP Live Streaming
RTP IETF
RTCP IETF
RTSP RealNetworks
RTMP Adobe
MMS Microsoft

HLS(Http Live Streaming)

1m3u8
2m3u8
3http

Post.title: macandroid
Post._content:
## [macandroid](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/19986214/setting-android-home-enviromental-variable-on-mac-os-x)
Where the Android-SDK is installed depends on how you installed it.
### 1.
If you downloaded the SDK through their website and then dragged/dropped the Application to your Applications folder, it's most likely here:
```html
/Applications/ADT/sdk (as it is in your case).
```

### 2.Homebrew
If you installed the SDK using Homebrew (brew cask install android-sdk), then it's located here:
```html
/usr/local/Caskroom/android-sdk/{YOUR_SDK_VERSION_NUMBER}
```

### 3.Android Studio
If the SDK was installed automatically as part of Android Studio then it's located here:
```html
/Users/{YOUR_USER_NAME}/Library/Android/sdk
```


sdk
```html
vim ~/.bash_profile
```
->i

```html
export ANDROID_HOME={YOUR_PATH}
```

```html
export PATH=$PATH:$ANDROID_HOME/tools:$ANDROID_HOME/platform-tools

#
export PATH=$PATH:<PATH 1>:<PATH 2>:<PATH 3>:------:<PATH N>
```

ESC :wq 

```html
source ~/.bash_profile
```

Post.title: nginxhttps
Post.content:
1.nginxhttps

nginxcert

upstream api2 {
    server www.domain.cn:444; # 
}

server {
    listen 443 ssl;

    server_name  www.domain.cn; #

    ssl_certificate      cert/domain.pem; #
    ssl_certificate_key  cert/domain.key; #
    ssl_session_cache    shared:SSL:1m;
    ssl_session_timeout  5m;
    ssl_ciphers  HIGH:!aNULL:!MD5; #
    ssl_prefer_server_ciphers  on;
    location / {
        root   /var/www/hexo; #
        index  index.html index.htm; #
    }

    location /api/ { #  /api
            proxy_pass https://api2/;
            port_in_redirect   on;
            proxy_redirect     off;
            proxy_set_header   Host             $host;
            proxy_set_header   X-Real-IP        $remote_addr;
            proxy_set_header   X-Forwarded-For  $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    }
}

nginx -s reload

2.nodejshttps

const https = require("https");

/**
 * Create HTTP server.
 */
// Configuare https
const httpsOption = {
    key : fs.readFileSync(path.resolve(__dirname, "./https/domain.key")),
    cert: fs.readFileSync(path.resolve(__dirname, "./https/domain.pem"))
}
// 444 nginx
https.createServer(httpsOption, app).listen(444);

Post.title: redux
Post.content:
redux

store.js

import { applyMiddleware, createStore } from 'redux';
import thunk from 'redux-thunk'; //action
import createSagaMiddleware from 'redux-saga'
import { persistStore, persistReducer } from 'redux-persist'; //
import reducers from '../reducer';
import storage from 'redux-persist/lib/storage'
import { createLogger } from 'redux-logger' //
import mySaga from '../actions/sagas'

// const logger = store => next => action => {
// 	let result = next(action);
// 	const arr = ['GROUP/COUNT_DOWN'];
// 	if(arr.indexOf(action.type) >= 0){ return result; }
// 	if(typeof action === 'function') console.log('dispatching a function');
// 	else console.log('dispatching', action);
// 	console.log('next state', store.getState());
// 	return result;
// }

const sagaMiddleware = createSagaMiddleware()

const logger = createLogger({
	predicate: (getState, action) => action.type !== 'GROUP/COUNT_DOWN' //
});

let middlewares = [
	thunk,
	sagaMiddleware
];

if (process.env.NODE_ENV === `development`) {
	middlewares.push(logger);
}

let createAppStore = applyMiddleware(...middlewares)(createStore);

const persistConfig = {
	key: 'root',
	storage
};
const persistedReducer = persistReducer(persistConfig, reducers)

export default () => {
	let store = createAppStore(persistedReducer)
	let persistor = persistStore(store)
	sagaMiddleware.run(mySaga)
	return { store, persistor }
}

1.redux-thunk

actionaction, dispatchgetState, action, dispatch action;

2.redux-saga

redux-thunkactiongeneratorthunkactiondispatch

3.redux-logger

reduxreduxlogger

const logger = store => next => action => {
	let result = next(action);
	const arr = ['GROUP/COUNT_DOWN'];
	if(arr.indexOf(action.type) >= 0){ return result; }
	if(typeof action === 'function') console.log('dispatching a function');
	else console.log('dispatching', action);
	console.log('next state', store.getState());
	return result;
}

//store.js

import { applyMiddleware, createStore } from 'redux'; //
import thunk from 'redux-thunk'; //action
import { persistStore, persistReducer } from 'redux-persist'; //
import { AsyncStorage } from 'react-native'; //
import reducers from '../reducers'; //combinereducer

//actionstate http://www.redux.org.cn/docs/advanced/Middleware.html
const logger = store => next => action => {
	if(typeof action === 'function') console.log('dispatching a function');
	else console.log('dispatching', action);
	let result = next(action);
	console.log('next state', store.getState());
	return result;
}

//
let middlewares = [
	logger,
	thunk
];

let createAppStore = applyMiddleware(...middlewares)(createStore);

//redux-persist
const persistConfig = {
	key: 'root',
	storage: AsyncStorage,
};
const persistedReducer = persistReducer(persistConfig, reducers)

export default () => {
	let store = createAppStore(persistedReducer)
	let persistor = persistStore(store)
	return { store, persistor }
}

loading

harmony
//index.js
import React, { Component } from 'react';
import { Provider } from 'react-redux';
import { PersistGate } from 'redux-persist/lib/integration/react'

import configureStore from './store/index';

let { store, persistor } = configureStore();

import Root from './root';


const App = () => {
	return (
		<Provider store={store}>
			<PersistGate loading={null} persistor={persistor}>
				<Root />
			</PersistGate>
		</Provider>
	);
};

export default App;

3.TabNavigator

{
	tabBarPosition: 'bottom',
	animationEnabled: true,
	configureTransition: (currentTransitionProps,nextTransitionProps) => ({
		timing: Animated.spring,
		tension: 1,
		friction: 35,
	}),
	swipeEnabled: true,
	tabBarOptions: {
		showIcon: true  //android
	}
}

4.

harmony
const StackOptions = ({navigation}) => {
    console.log(navigation);
    let {state,goBack} = navigation;
    
    // header
    const visible= state.params.isVisible;
    let header;
    if (visible === true){
        header = null;
    }
    const headerStyle = {backgroundColor:'#4ECBFC'};
    const headerTitle = state.params.title;
    const headerTitleStyle = {fontSize:FONT_SIZE(20),color:'white',fontWeight:'500'}
    const headerBackTitle = false;
    const headerLeft = (
        <Button
            isCustom={true}
            customView={
                            <Icon
                                name='ios-arrow-back'
                                size={30}
                                color='white'
                                style={{marginLeft:13}}
                            />
                        }
            onPress={()=>{goBack()}}
        />
    );
    return {headerStyle,headerTitle,headerTitleStyle,headerBackTitle,headerLeft,header}
};


harmony
const MyApp = StackNavigator({
    MyTab: {
        screen: MyTab,
    },
    Detail: {
        screen: Detail,
        navigationOptions: ({navigation}) => StackOptions({navigation})
    },
)}

5.Tabbar

harmony
const UserTab = StackNavigator({
	UserCenter: {
		screen: ({ navigation }) => (<UserCenter navigation={navigation} />),
		path: '/userCenter',
		navigationOptions: {
			headerTitle: '',
			headerTintColor: Color.while,
			headerStyle: styles.headerBg
		},
	},
	Login: {
		screen: ({ navigation }) => (<Login navigation={navigation} />),
		path: '/login',
		navigationOptions: {
			header: ({ navigation })=>(<ComHeader navigation={navigation} title=""/>),
			tabBarVisible: false //tabbar
		},
	},
});

7.replace

react navigationreplacereset
issues

harmony
//routes.js
import { StackNavigator } from 'react-navigation';
const HomeStack = StackNavigator(
	{
		Web: { screen: XXX, path: '/' },
		Login: { screen: XXX1 },
		...
	}
)

//dispathtypereplaceactiongetStateForAction
const prevGetStateForAction = HomeStack.router.getStateForAction;
HomeStack.router.getStateForAction = (action, state) => {
	if (state && action.type === "replace") {
		const routes = state.routes.slice(0, state.routes.length - 1);
		action.key =  `id-${Date.now()}-${routes.length - 1}`;
		routes.push(action);
		return {
			...state,
			routes,
			index: routes.length - 1
		};
	}
	return prevGetStateForAction(action, state);
};

	routeName: 'Login',
	key: 'Login',
	params: {
		id: 123
	}
});

Post.title: Typescript01 -
Post.content:
1.TSJS

TSJS JavaScript

TS

2.TS

  • stringnumberbooleansymbolbigintnullundefined
  • array Tuple() object(Object{})function
  • anyunknowvoidnerverEnum()

3.

//
let str: string = "Domesy"

// 
let num: number = 7

//
let bool: boolean = true

//symbol
let sym: symbol = Symbol();
    
//bigint
let big: bigint = 10n
    
//null
let nu: null = null

//undefined
let un: undefined = undefined

  • null undefined
  • null undefined
  • symbol sym1sym === sym1 false

4.

(1) Array

let arr1: number[] = [1, 2, 3]
    
let arr2: Array<number> = [1, 2, 3]

let arr2: Array<number> = [1, 2, '3'] // error

// 
let arr3: Array<number | string> = [1, 2, '3'] //ok

(2) Tuple()

Tuple , push

let t: [number, string] = [1, '2'] // ok
let t1: [number, string] = [1, 3] // error
let t2: [number, string] = [1] // error
let t3: [number, string] = [1, '1', true] // error


let t5: [number, string] = [1, '2'] // ok
t.push(2)
console.log(t) // [1, '2', 2]

let a =  t[0] // ok
let b = t[1] // ok
let 3t[2] // error

(3) object

  • object object {} 
let obj1: object = { a: 1, b: 2}
obj1.a = 3 // error

let obj2: { a: number, b: number } = {a: 1, b: 2} // 
obj2.a = 3 // ok
  • Object(O,,null`undefined
let obj: Object;
obj.a = 1; //error
obj = 1; // ok
obj = "a"; // ok
obj = true; // ok
obj = {}; // ok
obj = Symbol() //ok
obj = 10n //ok
obj = null; // error
obj = undefined; // error

(4) function

// 
function setName1(name: string) { //ok
    console.log("hello", name);
}
setName1("Domesy"); // "hello",  "Domesy"

// 
function setName2(name: string):string { //error
    console.log("hello", name);
    return 1
}
setName2("Domesy");

function setName3(name: string): string { //ok
    console.log("hello", name);
    return name
}
setName3("Domesy"); // "hello",  "Domesy"

//
const setName5 = (name:string) => console.log("hello", name);
setName5("Domesy") // "hello",  "Domesy"
 //   ? 
const setInfo1 = (name: string, age?: number) => console.log(name, age)
setInfo1('Domesy') //"Domesy",  undefined
setInfo1('Domesy', 7) //"Domesy",  7

//   = 
const setInfo2 = (name: string, age: number = 11) => console.log(name, age)
setInfo2('Domesy') //"Domesy",  11
setInfo2('Domesy', 7) //"Domesy",  7

//   ...
const allCount = (...numbers: number[]) => console.log(`${numbers.reduce((val, item) => (val += item), 0)}`)
allCount(1, 2, 3) //"6"

TypeScript 

let obj: any = {};
function setInfo(val: string): void;
function setInfo(val: number): void;
function setInfo(val: boolean): void;
function setInfo(val: string | number | boolean): void {
    if (typeof val === "string") {
        obj.name = val;
    } else {
        obj.age = val;
    }
}
setInfo("Domesy");
setInfo(7);
setInfo(true);
console.log(obj); // { name: 'Domesy', age: 7 }

5.

(1) any

any
any

let notSure: any = 4
notSure = "maybe a string"     //  string 
notSure = false                //  boolean 

notSure.name                   // 
notSure.getName()

(2) unknown

unknown any 

// ok
function divide(param: any) { 
  return param / 2;
}

// error 
function divide(param: unknown) { 
  return param / 2; //  
}

// ok
function divide(param: unknown) {
  return param as number / 2; // 
}

(3) void

void

//  void
function welcome(): void {
    console.log('hello')
}

(4) never

never

//  
function fn(msg: string): never { 
  throw new Error(msg)
}

notSure.name                   // 
notSure.getName()

(2) unknown

unknown any 

// ok
function divide(param: any) { 
  return param / 2;
}

// error 
function divide(param: unknown) { 
  return param / 2; //  
}

// ok
function divide(param: unknown) {
  return param as number / 2; // 
}

(3) void

void

//  void
function welcome(): void {
    console.log('hello')
}

(4) never

never

//  
function fn(msg: string): never { 
  throw new Error(msg)
}

Post.title: Typescript02 - interfaceclass
Post.content:
1.interface

interface() TS 

interface Person {
    readonly id: number // 
    name: string
    age: number
    nickname? : string // 
}

const p1: Person = {
    id: 1,
    name: 'lin',
    age: 18
}

p1.id = 2 // error

interface 

interface ISum {
    (x:number,y:number):number
}

const add:ISum = (num1, num2) => {
    return num1 + num2
}

interface RandomKey {
    [propName: string]: string
}

const obj: RandomKey = {
    a: 'hello',
    b: 'lin',
    c: 'welcome',
}

2.class

(1)

class Person {
    name: string
    constructor(name: string) {
        this.name = name
    }
    speak() {
        console.log(`${this.name} is speaking`)
    }
}

const p1 = new Person('lin')      //   

p1.name                           // 
p1.speak()

(2)

extends Student Person 

class Student extends Person {
    grade: number
    constructor(name: string,grade:number) {
        super(name) // super
        this.grade = grade
    }
    study() {
        console.log(`${this.name} needs study`)
    }
}

const s1 = new Student('lin')

s1.study()

(3)

class Student extends Person {
    speak() {
        return `Student ${super.speak()}`
    }
}

(4)

  • public: public
  • private:
  • protected:
  • static:

(5)

abstract 


abstract class Animal {}

const a = new Animal() // error

abstract class Animal {
    constructor(name:string) {
        this.name = name
    }
    public name: string
    public abstract sayHi():void
}

class Dog extends Animal {
    constructor(name:string) {
        super(name)
    }
    public sayHi() { // 
        console.log('wang')
    }
}

class Cat extends Animal {
    constructor(name:string) {
        super(name)
    }
    public sayHi() {
        console.log('miao')
    }
}


(6)this

class StudyStep {
  step1() {
    console.log('listen')
    return this
  }
  step2() {
    console.log('write')
    return this
  }
}

const s = new StudyStep()

s.step1().step2()    // 


class StudyStep {
  step1() {
    console.log('listen')
    return this
  }
  step2() {
    console.log('write')
    return this
  }
}

class MyStudyStep extends StudyStep {
  next() {
    console.log('before done, study next!')
    return this   
  }
}

const m = new MyStudyStep()

m.step1().next().step2().next()  //

3.interface class

implements:
implements class interface

interface MusicInterface {
    playMusic(): void
}

class Cellphone implements MusicInterface {
    playMusic() {}
}

class

:

interface CircleStatic {
    new (radius: number): void
    pi: number
}

const Circle:CircleStatic = class Circle {
    static pi: 3.14
    public radius: number
    public constructor(radius: number) {
        this.radius = radius
    }
}

Post.title: ubuntuhexo
Post._content:
### 1. ubuntu
#### 1gitnginx
```js
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install git nginx -
ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "email@xxx.com"
```

#### 2git
rootPermision Deniedgit
```js
adduser git

// 
vim /etc/sudoers
```
git
```js
## Allow root to run any commands anywhere
root    ALL=(ALL)     ALL
git     ALL=(ALL)     ALL # 
```
sshrsa
```js
ssh-keygen -t rsa -f ~/.ssh/github_id_rsa #

cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub  #ssh
```

```js
.ssh/authorized_keys
```

#### 3 Git 
 /var/repo 
```js
sudo mkdir /var/repo/
sudo chown -R $USER:$USER /var/repo/
sudo chmod -R 777 /var/repo/
```
git bare
```js
cd /var/repo/
git init --bare hexo_static.git
```

#### 4 Nginx 
```js
sudo mkdir -p /var/www/hexo

sudo chown -R $USER:$USER /var/www/hexo
sudo chmod -R 755 /var/www/hexo
```
nginx
```js
sudo vim /etc/nginx/sites-available/default

// 
...
server {
    listen 80 default_server;
    listen [::]:80 default_server ipv6only=on;
 
    root /var/www/hexo; # 
    index index.html index.htm;
...
```
nginx

```js
sudo service nginx restart
```
#### 4git
 hexo_static  HTML  Web  /var/www/hexo
```js
vim /var/repo/hexo_static.git/hooks/post-receive
```
 Git  Git 
```js
#!/bin/bash
 
git --work-tree=/var/www/hexo --git-dir=/var/repo/hexo_static.git checkout -f
```

```js
chmod +x /var/repo/hexo_static.git/hooks/post-receive
```

### 2.hexo
nodejsgit
```js
npm install hexo-cli hexo-server -g

// blog
hexo init ~/hexo_blog
```
hexo_config.yml  Hexo 
```js
url: http://server-ip #  IP 
root: /
permalink: :year/:month/:day/:title/
permalink_defaults:

# Writing draftpublish
new_post_name: :title.md # File name of new posts
default_layout: draft #  post
titlecase: false # Transform title into titlecase

#  repo: @ip:/
deploy:
    type: git
    repo: git@IP:/var/repo/hexo_static
    # repo: ubuntu@CVM IP:/var/repo/hexo_static
    branch: master
```
 Hexo  Git 
```js
npm install hexo-deployer-git --save
```

```js
hexo generate && hexo deploy

```

Post.title: ubuntuNodejs
Post._content:
### 1.nodejs
```js
wget https://nodejs.org/dist/v12.16.1/node-v12.16.1-linux-x64.tar.xz
```
 /opt/ 
```js
tar -xf node-v12.16.1-linux-x64.tar.xz
sudo mv node-v12.16.1-linux-x64 /opt/nodejs
```

### 2.
```js
sudo vim /etc/profile  #
sudo vim ~/.bashrc  #
#node
export NODE_HOME=/opt/nodejs
export PATH=$NODE_HOME/bin:$PATH

#npm
export NODE_PATH=/opt/nodejs/lib/node_modules

source  /etc/profile   
```

### 3.
nodenpmPATH
```js
sudo ln -s /opt/nodejs/bin/node  /usr/local/bin/node
sudo ln -s /opt/nodejs/bin/npm /usr/local/bin/npm
```
npmcnpm
```js
sudo npm install -g cnpm --registry=https://registry.npm.taobao.org
```

```js
sudo ln -s /opt/node/bin/cnpm /usr/local/bin/cnpm
```

### 4.
```js
node -v
npm -v
```

Post.title: ubuntudocker
Post._content:
[](https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/ubuntu/)

### 1.docker
```shell
sudo apt-get remove docker docker-engine docker.io containerd runc
```

### 2.
#### (1) 
```shell
sudo apt-get update
```

#### (2) 
```shell
sudo apt-get install \
    ca-certificates \
    curl \
    gnupg \
    lsb-release
```

#### (3) dockerGPG key
```shell
curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg
```

#### (4)
```shell
echo \
  "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu \
  $(lsb_release -cs) stable" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null
```

### 3.docker
```shell
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io
```

### 4.docker
```shell
sudo docker run hello-world
```

  $(lsb_release -cs) stable" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null

3.docker

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io

4.docker

sudo docker run hello-world

Post.title: ubuntuMongoDB
Post._content:
### 1.MongoDB
[](https://www.mongodb.com/try/download/community)

wget
```shell
wget https://fastdl.mongodb.org/linux/mongodb-linux-x86_64-ubuntu2004-5.0.7.tgz
```

```shell
tar -zxvf mongodb-linux-x86_64-ubuntu2004-5.0.7.tgz
```

### 2.MongoDB

```shell
sudo mkdir -p /var/lib/mongo     # 
sudo mkdir -p /var/log/mongodb   # 
```

```shell
./mongod --dbpath /var/lib/mongo --logpath /var/log/mongodb/mongod.log --fork
```

```shell
cat /var/log/mongodb/mongod.log # 
```

### 3.MongoDB

```shell
mongodump -h dbhost -d dbname -o dbdirectory
# -h MongoDB 127.0.0.1127.0.0.1:27017
# -d test
# -o c:\data\dump
```


```shell
mongorestore -h <hostname><:port> -d dbname <path>
# --host <:port>, -h <:port>MongoDB localhost:27017
# --db , -d test
# --drop
# <path> c:\data\dump\test
```
tips: 

### 4.pm2
```shell
npm install pm2 -g

# pm2 command not found 
ln -s /opt/nodejs/bin/pm2 /usr/local/bin

# node
whereis node
```

Post.title: vue keep-alive
Post.content:
ABBCB
A => BB => CC => BB => A

1.includemeta

metabeforeRouteLeavemetakeepAlivefalse

// App.vue
<div id="app">
    <transition name="fade">
        <keep-alive>
            <router-view v-if="$route.meta.keepAlive" />
        </keep-alive>
    </transition>
    <transition name="fade">
        <router-view v-if="!$route.meta.keepAlive" />
    </transition>
</div>
// router/index.js
const router = {
    {
        path: '/home',
        component: () => import('@/views/home/Home'),
        meta: { keepAlive: true }, // 
    }
}
  • include
<template>
    <keep-alive :include="keepPages" :max="5">
        <router-view />
    </keep-alive>
</template>

<script lang="ts">
import { Vue, Component } from 'vue-property-decorator'

@Component({})
export default class Layout extends Vue{
    get keepPages() {
        return this.$store.getters.keepPages
    }
}
</script>

2.vuex

// store/modules/app.ts

// keepPages
const getDefaultState = () => {
    return {
        keepPages: ['UserActivity'] // UserActivity
    }
}

const state = getDefaultState()

const mutations = {
    RESET_STATE: (state: any) => {
        Object.assign(state, getDefaultState())
    },
    CHANGE_PAGES(state:any, arr:any) {
        state.keepPages = arr;
    },
    KEEP_PAGE(state:any, name:any) {
        const arr = state.keepPages;
        if (!arr.includes(name)) {
            arr.push(name);
        }
        state.keepPages = arr;
    },
    REMOVE_PAGE(state:any, name:any) {
        state.keepPages = state.keepPages.filter((i:any) => i !== name);
    }
}

export default {
    namespaced: true,
    state,
    mutations,
    actions: {}
}

3.

// UserActivity
<template>
    ...
</template>

<script lang="ts">
import { Component, Vue } from 'vue-property-decorator'

@Component({
    beforeRouteLeave(to:any, form: any, next:any) {
        // A
        if (to.name === 'UserArea') {
            this.$store.commit("app/REMOVE_PAGE", this.$options.name);
        }
        next()
    }
})
export default class UserActivity extends Vue{
    mounted() {
        // 
        this.$store.commit("app/KEEP_PAGE", this.$options.name);
    }
}
</script>

Post.title: tensorFlow.js
Post.content:
cdn
https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@tensorflow/tfjs@0.9.0

1.(Tensor)Variable


Tensor tf.tensor ,shape

// 2x3 Tensor
const shape = [2, 3]; // 2 , 3 
const a = tf.tensor([1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 10.0, 20.0, 30.0], shape);
a.print(); // 
// :    [[1 , 2 , 3 ],
//          [10, 20, 30]]

// shape:
const b = tf.tensor([[1.0, 2.0, 3.0], [10.0, 20.0, 30.0]]);
b.print();
// :    [[1 , 2 , 3 ],
//          [10, 20, 30]]

const a = tf.scalar(3.14);
a.print(); // 

const b = tf.tensor2d([[2, 3, 4], [5, 6, 7]]);
b.print(); // 

const c = tf.zeros([2, 3]);
c.print(); // 230

const d = tf.ones([3, 5]);
d.print(); // 351

assigntensor

const initialValues = tf.zeros([5]);
const biases = tf.variable(initialValues); // biases
biases.print(); // : [0, 0, 0, 0, 0]

const updatedValues = tf.tensor1d([0, 1, 0, 1, 0]);
biases.assign(updatedValues); //  biases
biases.print(); // : [0, 1, 0, 1, 0]

2.



1ops

function predict(input) {
  // y = a * x ^ 2 + b * x + c
  // More on tf.tidy in the next section
  return tf.tidy(() => {
    const x = tf.scalar(input);

    const ax2 = a.mul(x.square());
    const bx = b.mul(x);
    const y = ax2.add(bx).add(c);

    return y;
  });
}
//tf.scalar()
const a = tf.scalar(2);
const b = tf.scalar(4);
const c = tf.scalar(8);

const result = predict(2);
result.print()

(2)API tf.model

const model = tf.sequential();
model.add(
  tf.layers.simpleRNN({
    units: 20,
    recurrentInitializer: 'GlorotNormal',
    inputShape: [80, 4]
  })
);

const optimizer = tf.train.sgd(LEARNING_RATE);
model.compile({optimizer, loss: 'categoricalCrossentropy'});
model.fit({x: data, y: labels});

3.

(1)disposedisposeGPU

const x = tf.tensor2d([[0.0, 2.0], [4.0, 6.0]]);
const x_squared = x.square();

x.dispose();
x_squared.dispose();

(2)tf.tidyGPU

const average = tf.tidy(() => {
  const y = tf.tensor1d([1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0]);
  const z = tf.ones([4]);

  return y.sub(z).square().mean();
});

average.print()


tf.tidyPromisetf.tidyUI

tf.tidyTensorFlow.jstidydispose

Post.title: vue3 - 01.vue2.03.0
Post.content:
1.

vue3.0vite

# npm 6.x
npm init vite@latest my-vue-app --template vue

# npm 7+, 
npm init vite@latest my-vue-app -- --template vue

devtoolbeta

2.main.js

vue3api

// 3.0
import { createApp } from 'vue';
import router from './router';
import store from './store';
import App from './App.vue';

createApp(App).use(router).use(store).mount('#app');

Vue

// 2.0
import Vue from 'vue';
import App from './App.vue';
import router from './router';
import store from './store';

new Vue({
  router,
  store,
  render: (h) => h(App),
}).$mount('#app');

3.router

routerapi

// 3.0
import * as VueRouter from 'vue-router'
// 
const routes = [
    { path: '/', component: () => import('@/views/home/index.vue') },
]
  
//  `routes` 
const router = VueRouter.createRouter({
    history: VueRouter.createWebHashHistory(), // hash
    routes,
})

export default router
// 2.0
import Vue from 'vue';
import Router from 'vue-router';

Vue.use(Router);
// 
const routes = [
    { path: '/', component: () => import('@/views/home/index.vue') },
]

const router = new Router({
	routes,
	mode: 'history'
});

export default router

3.store

storeapi

// 3.0
import { createStore } from 'vuex'

const store = createStore({
    store: {},
    mutations: {},
    actions: {},
    module: {}
})

export default store
// 2.0
import Vue from 'vue'
import Vuex from 'vuex'
import getters from './getters'

Vue.use(Vuex)

// modulests
const modulesFiles = require.context('./modules', true, /\.ts$/)
const modules = modulesFiles.keys().reduce((modules: any, modulePath: any) => {
    // set './app.js' => 'app'
    const moduleName = modulePath.replace(/^\.\/(.*)\.\w+$/, '$1')
    const value = modulesFiles(modulePath)
    modules[moduleName] = value.default
    return modules
}, {})

const store = new Vuex.Store({
    modules,
    getters
})

export default store

import store from './store';

new Vue({
  router,
  store,
  render: (h) => h(App),
}).$mount('#app');

3.router

routerapi

// 3.0
import * as VueRouter from 'vue-router'
// 
const routes = [
    { path: '/', component: () => import('@/views/home/index.vue') },
]
  
//  `routes` 
const router = VueRouter.createRouter({
    history: VueRouter.createWebHashHistory(), // hash
    routes,
})

export default router
// 2.0
import Vue from 'vue';
import Router from 'vue-router';

Vue.use(Router);
// 
const routes = [
    { path: '/', component: () => import('@/views/home/index.vue') },
]

const router = new Router({
	routes,
	mode: 'history'
});

export default router

3.store

storeapi

// 3.0
import { createStore } from 'vuex'

const store = createStore({
    store: {},
    mutations: {},
    actions: {},
    module: {}
})

export default store
// 2.0
import Vue from 'vue'
import Vuex from 'vuex'
import getters from './getters'

Vue.use(Vuex)

// modulests
const modulesFiles = require.context('./modules', true, /\.ts$/)
const modules = modulesFiles.keys().reduce((modules: any, modulePath: any) => {
    // set './app.js' => 'app'
    const moduleName = modulePath.replace(/^\.\/(.*)\.\w+$/, '$1')
    const value = modulesFiles(modulePath)
    modules[moduleName] = value.default
    return modules
}, {})

const store = new Vuex.Store({
    modules,
    getters
})

export default store

function genNameMixin(key, funcKey) {
  return {
    data() {
      return {
        [key]: genRandomName()
      }
    },
    methods: {
      [funcKey]: function(v) {
        this.[key] = v
      } 
    }
  }
}

  mixins: [
    genNameMixin('firstName', 'setFirstName'),
    genNameMixin('lastName', 'setLastName'),
  ]
}

4.openDatabase

var dataBase;
this.createDatabase = function() {
    dataBase = openDatabase("teacher", "1.0", "", 1024 * 1024, function() {});
    if (!dataBase) {
        alert("");
    } else {
        alert("");
    }
}

this.createTable = function() {
    dataBase.transaction(function(context) {
        context.executeSql(
            "create table if not exists teacher (id REAL UNIQUE, name TEXT)", [],
            function(context, result) {
                alert('teacher');
            },
            function(context, error) {
                alert('teacher:' + error.message);
            });
    });
}

this.insertData = function() {
    dataBase.transaction(function(context) {
        context.executeSql(
            "insert into teacher (id, name) values(?, ?)", ["1", 'aa'],
            function() {
                console.log('');
            },
            function(context, error) {
                console.log(': ' + error.message);
            });
    });
    dataBase.transaction(function(context) {
        context.executeSql(
            "insert into teacher (id, name) values(?, ?)", ["2", 'bb'],
            function() {
                console.log('');
            },
            function(context, error) {
                console.log(': ' + error.message);
            });
    });
    dataBase.transaction(function(context) {
        context.executeSql(
            "insert into teacher (id, name) values(?, ?)", ["3", 'cc'],
            function() {
                console.log('');
            },
            function(context, error) {
                console.log(': ' + error.message);
            });
    });
}

this.queryData = function() {
    dataBase.transaction(function(context) {
        context.executeSql(
            "select * from teacher", [],
            function(context, result) {
                console.log(result);
                console.log(context);

            },
            function(context, error) {
                alert(': ' + error.message);
            });
    });
}

//
this.dropTable = function() {
    dataBase.transaction(function(tx) {
        tx.executeSql('drop table teacher');
    });
}

webpack eject scripts
react-app-rewired react CRA

CRA react-app-rewiredconfig-overrides.js webpack 

/* config-overrides.js */
const { injectBabelPlugin } = require('react-app-rewired');
const path = require('path');
function resolve(dir) {
	return path.join(__dirname, '.', dir)
}
module.exports = function override(config, env) {
	config = injectBabelPlugin(['import', { libraryName: 'antd-mobile', style: 'css' }], config);

	config.resolve.alias = {
		'@': resolve('src')
	};
	config.devtool = process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development'? '#eval-source-map': false;

	return config;
};

overrideconfig webpack config loader plugins config

package.json

/* package.json */
  "scripts": {
-   "start": "react-scripts start",
+   "start": "react-app-rewired start",
-   "build": "react-scripts build",
+   "build": "react-app-rewired build",
-   "test": "react-scripts test --env=jsdom",
+   "test": "react-app-rewired test --env=jsdom"
}

const overrides = require('../config-overrides');
const webpackConfigPath = paths.scriptVersion + "/config/webpack.config.prod";

// load original config
const webpackConfig = require(webpackConfigPath);
// override config in memory
require.cache[require.resolve(webpackConfigPath)].exports =
  overrides.webpack(webpackConfig, process.env.NODE_ENV);
// run original script
require(paths.scriptVersion + '/scripts/build');

### 10.Cordova android emulator cannot read property 'replace' of undefined
Tracked it down to file /platforms/android/cordova/lib/emulator.js line 202:

var num = target.split('(API level ')1.replace(')', '');

Replace it with a regex search and extraction:

var num = target.match(/\d+/)[0];
